question: A data structure is a way of organizing and storing data efficiently.
Data structures are only used in programming languages like C and Java.
Efficient data structures help improve the performance of algorithms.
Data structures do not affect the memory usage of a program.
An array is an example of a data structure.
Data structures are only used for storing numbers and cannot store text.
Choosing the right data structure can help reduce the time complexity of an algorithm.
A good data structure allows faster data retrieval and modification.
Data structures are not useful in real-world applications.
A data structure can store multiple types of data like integers, characters, and strings.
The main purpose of a data structure is to make data access more difficult.
Data structures are important in fields like databases, artificial intelligence, and networking.
Abstract Data Types (ADT) define only the implementation details of a data structure.
Data structures can be categorized as linear and non-linear types.
A list is considered a type of data structure.
Data structures are only used in large-scale applications and not in small programs.
A database management system (DBMS) uses data structures to store and organize data efficiently.
Every program needs a data structure to function properly.
Data structures are useful for searching, sorting, and managing data.
Data structures are only theoretical concepts and have no practical applications.
